headline: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: A homemade crust made with butter and egg yolk encases this classic Southern style pecan pie.
name: Southern Pecan Pie II

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Mix yolk with water and stir in until mixture forms a ball. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Roll out and place in a 9 inch pie plate.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C.)

Place pecans in the bottom of pie crust. In a large bowl, Stir together 3/4 cup of sugar and flour. Mix in the eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter and vanilla. Blend well and pour over pecans in crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until golden brown and filling is set.

review.reviewBody: This has been my go to for years. The crust is what makes this pie. One of my favorites to make.

Mine turned out runny. I'd read the reviews that said the same, but figured they must have done something different, right? Well, I followed the recipe to a T and it rose really high and was runny in the center - then when I took it out, it collapsed in the center. My husband says he'll still try it, so I guess we'll see. Christmas is in two days. Thankfully, I made another one with another recipe and it turned out perfect.
Flavor was okay but very runny. Was like soup.
I love this recipe. The only thing I did different was instead of using 3/4 cup white sugar in the mix, I used 1 cup of brown sugar.

Just like
 Edwards pie in the grocery store I have found..
This is simple to make and is always a big hit at our Thanksgiving. I have made it 7 yrs straight and always it gets great feedback from our guests. It will be a staple at our Thanksgiving always.

This recipe was fantastic!!! I will definitely be making this pie again. I've had very little luck making good pie pastry in the past. (I had to get pastry from my mom or her sister!) However, this pastry recipe worked very well for me. I'll be using it for all of my pies in the future. I did have to add an extra tablespoon of ice-cold water but otherwise I followed the recipe exactly and the results were wonderful.
This is the first pecan pie I have made that we did not have to pass out the straws to eat it. My husband ate 3 pieces. It was not overly sweet.

This pecan pie is very easy to make and tastes wonderful. I never knew making a pie crust from scratch could be so easy. Even i couldn't mess it up!! Hint - if you don't have time to make the crust and want to use frozen premade - make sure to use the "deep dish" ones because this recipe yields a large amount of filling.

I absolutely Love this recipe! Ive made this pie for the last 3 years and every year the number of request grows! I think last year I made 20 just for Christmas, it certainly made my mother in law change her mind about Pecan Pie.
I dont know what I did wrong but, the consistency was awful. It was like pecan pie soup....The flavor was good so I gave it 3 stars.
perfect except i'd double the filling because it's so good

This was my very first pie ever and it was very easy to follow. The filling was delicious but I think I just need more practice with pie crust because mine came out a little dry. It was still good but I don't think I have the art of pie crust making perfected and I didn't have a food processor to mix it like some places suggest. But overall is was a great pecan pie!

Very delicious pie! Not too stiff and not at all runny. One thing I would suggest is to mix in the pecans with the mixture, not put them on the bottom because then when the pie is baked, the pecans tend to come off the pie more easily because they are not mixed in with the mixture. Overall, very delicious and I will be sure to make it again!
Lighter than my normal recipe. I used dark corn syrup out of personal preference. Turned out great. This will be my pecan pie recipe from now on... until another recipe takes the title.
Based on my husbands review it was just "good". Followed the recipe to a T. I have yet to find a pecan pie recipe to blow my husband away. Will keep looking.

GREAT! Very traditional, and a lot of flavor. It is EXACTLY what you picture as a pecan pie. I had to add an extra Tablespoon of iced water to the crust mixture. Also, it took about 20 extra minutes to bake, but it was no big deal. Just make sure when you give the pan a slight shake that it doesn't move like jello. I would also suggest putting aluminum foil around the edges of the crust, so it doesn't get too brown. Overall this pie was awesome and not difficult to make!
I really like this recipe! I'm not big on anything really sweet, so this was excellent.
This pie was the talk of my dinner party last night!! Thanks
My husband LOVES pecan pie. Tonight he said this pecan pie was the best ever. Excellent recipe. I didn't make the homemade crust in the recipe. I'm sure it would be even better with that.
I made this for Christmas and everyone raved. Will have to make it again soon....Maybe Easter!
Very easy to make and delicious. I used a pre-made shell and substituted maple syrup for the corn syrup. Excellent!
THIS is sooooo AWESOME I dont like pecan pie but I have to say this is the BEST I have made it SEVERAL times withing the last month. GREAT JOB!!!!
I followed this recipe to the letter, it turned out more like pecan cake rather than the gooey pecan pie I was craving. I will continue to look for another recipe

I used a different filling, the Unbeatable Pecan Pie recipe because it used maple syrup.

A lot of reviews on this recipe made mention of how good the crust was. It really is a delicious crust. I will probably use this crust for all of my future pies.

This recipe was the 1st pecan pie I had ever made and it made me look like an old pro! I made it for my father in law for his birthday because it is his favorite and he LOVED it! My husband said it was a close runner up to the "name-brand" pecan pies I order at Christmas time - no more ordering for me! :)
I liked this a lot. I cheated and used a ready-made pie crust.

I will say that my Fiance is from the south (GA) and loves Pecan pie. When I followed this recipe to the "T" he fell in love with me all over again! I have made it 3 or 4 times for him already and it has only been 2 weeks. This recipe is GREAT!!!!
Good, not too sweet but I am still searching for the perfect recipe.
This is a great pecan pie recipe, however I would not recommend going with a store bought pie crust it comes out much better with the crust recipe listed plus it is much tastier.

I'm from England and I made this recipe for my friends in america this thanksgiving, having never made a pecan pie before. The recipe was easy to follow and the pie tuned out perfectly. Was loved by all. It makes a very pretty presentation.
I am use to a sweeter pecan pie. This pie is "thick" I think too much egg? The crust is DELICIOUS. It still tasted ok. I am looking for a better recipe.
I made this as a "gift" for someone who loves pecan pies and he loved it. It was very easy to make, recipe was really easy to follow. I will definitely be making this one again- for me next time.

I've been trying for years to find a recipe to duplicate "Edward's Pecan Pie", which is my favorite and which I can no longer find in the market; this is very close. It has that smooth buttery flavor - a filling that doesn't over power the pecans, but compliments them. I made it to take to a party and everyone loved it.
